page.title: 13Conservation
page.content: The people of Todmorden are proud of their heretage and want to conserve all the things that give the area a special identity.Conservation means the considered control and enhancement of the inherent character of an area. In effect it means trying to protect features that have made an area an attractive place to work and live. In the south-east corner of our survey area lies the village of Lumbutts.It is only small, but was once more important than Todmorden, because it was on a packhorse route.It is situated on a plateau at a height of 600-700 feet.All the houses are made of Millstone Grit and have low-pitched, stone roofs.The windows are small, square or stone mullioned. Inside the beamed ceilings and stone slab floors add to the character of the building.Slide 'C' shows Lumbutts.
